The U.S. approved annual licenses for Samsung & SK Hynix to ship chipmaking equipment to China in 2026 as current exemptions expire.

This avoids a hard cutoff while preserving leverage which is why $MU is moving pre-market.

I think AI moves into a phase in 2026 where social acceptance starts to matter and in a midterm year public sentiment matters a lot.

If people start to see AI as a job killer instead of a productivity tool then don't be surprise to see politicians start playing politician. 

This would be idiotic given the active AI arms race with China but if AI truly turns unpopular then a temporary slowdown becomes an easy lever to pull.
Here‚Äôs Warren Buffett talking about the dumbest stock he ever bought

$META Chief AI Officer Alexandr Wang said Manus AI is joining Meta to support general-purpose agent development across Meta AI and its products.

This brings agent capability closer to Meta‚Äôs distribution enabling AI features to scale across Instagram, WhatsApp & Messenger.

The most important metric in the AI economy is the cost of intelligence.

If a system can answer faster, serve more users at once and run more complex models without breaking latency then it wins even if the sticker price is higher.

That‚Äôs where $NVDA GB200 separates itself.

Hello alpha into year end.
With Bloomberg Tech, I broke down why the upcoming AI monetization wave will widen (not shrink or plateau) to where both Nvidia $NVDA and other chipmakers continue to benefit.

Since 2019, data center deals in the US and Canada have totaled nearly $160 billion, followed by $40 billion in APAC and just over $24 billion in Europe, per S&P Global.

$NVDA $AMD $GOOG $MSFT $AMZN

SoftBank is acquiring DigitalBridge $DBRG for $4 billion including debt, in a move aiming to strengthen its positioning in next-gen AI infrastructure. 

The deal is expected to close in the second half of 2026.

$NVDA $AMD

800G optical transceivers are forecast to see 24 million shipments in 2025 before rising 2.6X to 63 million units in 2026, with high-speed optical interconnects becoming critical for performance and scalability of large GPU clusters. 

For our members, we recently covered a handful of companies set to capitalize on this wave of optics growth. 
io-fund.com/premium-services‚Ä¶

üì∫ MARKET PAUSES NEAR HIGHS & THE JANUARY EFFECT NAMES

$SPY and $QQQ are still holding the 8-day, despite fading momentum.

The bigger question now is how new-year flows will impact markets‚Äîwhether fresh capital squeezes winners higher before late-January selling, or whether rotation takes over.

I am starting to shift my focus to January effect setups ‚Äì beaten-down names that may rebound as tax-loss selling pressure disappears. 

Some names on my list: $CMG $NKE $TTD
